"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534b3c7b6368725686540300#post_534b3c7b6368725686540300

Seraphim's point was why nations in the northern latitudes seem to oppress nations of more southern latitudes more often. Belgium to the Congo, France to the African north-west, England to India, Spain to Mexico, Portugal to Brazil.

And then forgetting that there are plenty of Empire that conquest along their own environment, or neighborhoods. And not taking warmer, richer places.

China is not warmer than Japan, or any more tropical than Japan.
topics.author: 4fe4bf947f123b175b000001

topics.body: The Mongols also lorded over most of the Old World for a time. However, a lot of their thinking minds were of Chinese and Central Asian/Middle Eastern origin, from territories they've annexed in their conquest. Japan could've come under Mongol rule under Kublai Khan if it wasn't for a giant ocean storm that destroyed much of Khan's fleet. Japanese lucked out. And the large ships and sophisticated weapons in the Mongol arsenal were Chinese origin. Japan was a rather backward warring feudal state back then, compared to the mainland.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534b3b68636872443e260100#post_534b3b68636872443e260100
The only reason why to have a lunar colony is to mine helium-3 which can potentially be used for cold fusion reactors.  The most realistic lunar colony we'll ever see is a couple dozen technicians working at a mining outpost maintaining the machinery.

What I mean by this is watch the 2009 movie "Moon". . well minus the plot twist and more technicians.

Russia's plan for the moon is just dumb.

topics.author: 509129db7f123b36cb010fa5

topics.body:
"@boz":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534b3f45636872443e580300#post_534b3f45636872443e580300
The problem with making a moonbase right now is that we don't have the technology yet for fusion reactors to replace fossil fuels; we're still at least a decade off from that(they made a huge breakthrough recently though).  What I mean by this is making a lunar colony right now is just dumb.

Whichever company figures out fusion first will probably be the ones to make a lunar colony for mining helium-3 and presto for the next couple decades they will have the *ENTIRE* energy market cornered.

It's probably going to be boeing in the end, cause they've been making some big strides as of late and they're already big enough to afford the investment.

So yeah not only does russia's plan not make a lick of fucking sense, but they're probably not even going to be the ones to make a lunar colony anyhow.  They're just calling dibs when they haven't even gotten what they're calling dibs over in the first place.  It'd be like if I called dibs on the first copy of half-life 3 when the game hasn't even come out yet and we don't even know when the game is coming out in the first place.

topics.body:
"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/534b47f46368723aa4330000#post_534b47f46368723aa4330000
Nah; that's not the problem; the current problem with them is that the reactors are too inefficient right now for it to be economically feasible.  I remember the one in the Britain for a test run powered all of the mainland for a second and a half to test their output; reminder it was just a test.

Say if boeing does get there first we're looking at entire continents being able to be powered by a single reactors.  It's probably why so many companies are trying to be first, cause they know if they are first then they're going to be making tens of trillions of dollars worldwide.

The problem is they're trying to figure out why their reactors are so inefficient.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600
